Row.Text: Our people are now constructing great tapestries and speaking French. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Construct the White Tower

Our enemies in this realm are no doubt many. We must therefore construct a great keep; a symbol of our new-found dominion in these lands.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Normandy [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have captured at least one capital from a major civilization [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Medieval Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Cities with a Castle are in [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance for 50% less time [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Note: The [ICON_GOLD] Gold cost increases with the number of Castles[ENDCOLOR]

Our enemies in this realm are no doubt many. We must therefore construct a great keep; a symbol of our newfound dominion in these lands.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Cities with a Castle are in [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance for 50% less time
Compile the Domesday Book

Our conquests have afforded us an untapped wealth. Let us commission a great survey of all men and their holdings in this realm, and ensure that we are accorded our due.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Normandy [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have captured at least one capital from a major civilization [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Medieval Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each Courthouse increases [ICON_GOLD] Gold output by 15% [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Note: The [ICON_GOLD] Gold cost increases with the number of Courthouses[ENDCOLOR]

Our conquests have afforded us an untapped wealth. Let us commission a great survey of all men and their holdings in this realm, and ensure that we are accorded our due.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each Courthouse increases [ICON_GOLD] Gold output by 15%
{1_LeaderName} of Normandy has finished compiling the Domesday Book survey of his conquered peoples.
Revolt of the Earls
A noble's revolt has broken out in the city of {1_CityName}, opposing our claim to the throne of {2_CivName}.[NEWLINE]
We must crush this revolt!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]3 enemy Knights appear near the city of {1_CityName}[ENDCOLOR]
We have resolved to crush the rebellion posed by the nobility of our conquered foes.
I'm sure we can earn their trust.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]20% chance that 2 enemy Knights appear near the city of {2_CityName}[ENDCOLOR]
We have managed to placate the noble's revolt with an offering of gold.
Our efforts to placate the noble's revolt with an offering of gold has failed, and they have taken our gold and attacked us anyway!
A noble's revolt has broken out in the {1_CivName} against the claim of {2_LeaderName} over the throne of {3_CivName}.
Bayeux Tapestry
Our dear wife has suggested to us that we patronize the construction of a great tapestry, depicting the victory of the Norman armies against the armies of our defeated foes.
Very well. Have it begun at once.

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain the Bayeux Tapestry (+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +10XP for Melee, Ranged, and Mounted Units) in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.[ENDCOLOR]
We have agreed to patronise the construction of the Bayeux Tapestry.
A waste of coin.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Nothing[ENDCOLOR]
We have refused to patronise the construction of the Bayeux Tapestry.
Bayeux Tapestry
+10 XP for Melee, Ranged, and Mounted Units trained in this city.

The Bayeux Tapestry is an embroidered cloth nearly 70 metres (230 ft) long and 50 centimetres (20 in) tall, which depicts the events leading up to the Norman conquest of England concerning William, Duke of Normandy, and Harold, Earl of Wessex, later King of England, and culminating in the Battle of Hastings. The tapestry consists of some fifty scenes with Latin tituli, embroidered on linen with coloured woollen yarns. It is likely that it was commissioned by Bishop Odo, William's half-brother, and made in England—not Bayeux—in the 1070s. In 1729 the hanging was rediscovered by scholars at a time when it was being displayed annually in Bayeux Cathedral. The tapestry is now exhibited at the Musée de la Tapisserie de Bayeux in Bayeux, Normandy, France
Matilda of Flanders
